item.title: 亿万富翁 H&M 创始家族加速收购股份
item.description: 周二的监管文件显示，亿万富翁佩尔松家族加快了对其创立的 H&M 时尚帝国的股份收购步伐，这可能会加剧人们对该公司最终可能被私有化的猜测。【原文：The billionaire Persson family has picked up the pace of share purchases in the H&M fashion empire it founded, regulatory filings showed on Tuesday, potentially boosting speculation the company may eventually be taken private.】

item.title: 消息人士称，AQR 资本管理公司年中实现两位数回报
item.description: 本周二，一位消息人士称，亿万富翁投资者克里夫-阿斯内斯（Cliff Asness）的 AQR 资本管理公司（AQR Capital Management）旗下的几只基金在今年上半年取得了正收益。【原文：Billionaire investor Cliff Asness's AQR Capital Management finished the first half of the year with positive returns in several of its funds, said a source on Tuesday.】

item.title: 通用汽车第二季度美国汽车销量增长 7
item.description: 通用汽车公司周二公布，受经济型跨界 SUV 需求的推动，第二季度美国汽车销量有所增长。【原文：General Motors reported higher second-quarter U.S. sales on Tuesday, aided by demand for its affordable crossover SUVs.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，Scale AI 的更大竞争对手 Surge AI 寻求最高 10 亿美元的融资
item.description: 消息人士告诉路透社，与 Scale AI 竞争的数据标签公司 Surge AI 已聘请顾问，准备在该公司历史上的首次融资中筹集多达 10 亿美元的资金。【原文：Surge AI, a data-labeling firm that competes with Scale AI, has hired advisors to raise as much as $1 billion in the first capital raising in the firm's history, sources told Reuters, as it seeks to capitalize on growing user demand amid Scale AI's recent customer exodus.】

item.title: 据《泰晤士报》报道，阿斯利康首席执行官希望在美国市场上市
item.description: 据《泰晤士报》周二援引多位消息人士的话报道，阿斯利康首席执行官帕斯卡尔-索里奥（Pascal Soriot）正在考虑将该公司的股票市场迁往美国。【原文：AstraZeneca chief executive Pascal Soriot is considering moving the company's stock market listing to the United States, The Times reported on Tuesday, citing multiple sources.】

item.title: 全球红利基金因降息希望和市场恐慌而吸引资金流入
item.description: 由于投资者在应对地缘政治和经济紧张局势的同时寻求收益稳定的资产，投资于分红股票的全球基金在经历了两年不温不火的投资者需求之后，今年吸引了大量资金流入。【原文：Global funds that invest in dividend-paying stocks are drawing strong flows this year, following two years of tepid investor demand, as investors seek assets with a stable income while they navigate geopolitical and economic tensions.】

item.title: 美国五月建筑支出再次下降
item.description: 由于抵押贷款利率上升和库存增加对独户住宅项目造成压力，5 月份美国建筑支出下降。【原文：U.S. construction spending fell in May as higher mortgage rates and rising inventory weighed on single-family housing projects.】

item.title: 美国 5 月职位空缺意外增加，招聘人数下降
item.description: 美国5月份的职位空缺出乎意料地增加，但招聘人数的下降加剧了劳动力市场转入低速增长的迹象，因为特朗普政府对进口商品征收关税的不确定性，为期90天的提高互惠关税的暂停期即将结束。【原文：U.S. job openings unexpectedly increased in May, but a decline in hiring added to signs that the labor market had shifted into lower gear amid uncertainty over the Trump administration's tariffs on imports, with a 90-day pause on higher reciprocal duties drawing to an end.】

item.title: 鲍威尔不排除 7 月降息可能后，美联储降息押注上升
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）在被问及 7 月考虑降息是否为时过早时表示，他 "不能说"，但决定将取决于经济数据，随后金融市场对美联储最快本月开始降息的押注上升。【原文：Financial market bets rose that the Federal Reserve could start interest-rate cuts as soon as this month after Fed Chair Jerome Powell, asked if July was too soon to consider rate cuts, said he "can't say" but that the decision would depend on the economic data.】

item.title: 美国制造业受关税影响陷入疲软
item.description: 6 月份，美国制造业依然低迷，新订单低迷，投入品价格攀升，这表明特朗普政府对进口商品征收关税继续阻碍了企业提前规划的能力。【原文：U.S. manufacturing remained sluggish in June, with new orders subdued and prices paid for inputs creeping higher, suggesting that the Trump administration's tariffs on imported goods continued to hamper businesses' ability to plan ahead.】

item.title: 各国政府和多边贷款机构推动暂停偿债
item.description: 西班牙周二宣布，一些富裕的债权国和多边贷款人发起了一项倡议，旨在为主权借款人在发生气候或人道主义危机时的债务偿还提供喘息空间。【原文：A number of wealthy creditor nations and multilateral lenders have launched an initiative that aims to give sovereign borrowers breathing space on debt payments in the event of a climate or humanitarian crisis, Spain announced on Tuesday.】

item.title: 福特第二季度美国汽车销量增长 14
item.description: 福特汽车公司周二公布，受皮卡需求增加的推动，第二季度美国销量增长了 14.2%。【原文：Ford Motor reported a 14.2% rise in second-quarter U.S. sales on Tuesday, driven by higher demand for its pickup trucks.】

item.title: 鲍威尔重申美联储将等待更多数据后再降息
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔重申，美国央行计划在降息前 "等待并进一步了解 "关税对通胀的影响，再次搁置了唐纳德-特朗普总统关于立即大幅降息的要求。【原文：U.S. Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell reiterated the U.S. central bank plans to "wait and learn more" about the impact of tariffs on inflation before lowering interest rates, again setting aside President Donald Trump's demands for immediate and deep rate cuts.】

item.title: 巴西国家开发银行考虑设立以人工智能和数据中心为重点的投资基金
item.description: 巴西国家开发银行（BNDES [RIC:RIC:BNDES.UL]）规划执行官 Nelson Barbosa 周二表示，该银行正在考虑创建一个专注于人工智能和数据中心的投资基金。【原文：Brazil's state development bank BNDES [RIC:RIC:BNDES.UL] is considering creating an investment fund focused on AI and data centers, planning executive Nelson Barbosa said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，阿夫沙尔离职后，马斯克将负责特斯拉在欧洲和美国的销售业务
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周二援引知情人士的话报道，在奥米德-阿夫沙尔（Omead Afshar）高调离职后，特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）已接管了欧洲和美国的销售工作。【原文：Tesla chief executive Elon Musk has assumed oversight of sales in Europe and the U.S. following the high-profile departure of Omead Afshar, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 华纳音乐与贝恩资本成立合资公司，拟向音乐目录投资高达 12 亿美元
item.description: 华纳音乐集团（Warner Music Group）和私募股权公司贝恩资本（Bain Capital）周二宣布，双方将成立一家合资企业，收购高达 12 亿美元的音乐目录。【原文：Warner Music Group and private equity firm Bain Capital are launching a joint venture to purchase up to $1.2 billion in music catalogs, the companies announced Tuesday.】

item.title: 波音任命内部人士斯蒂芬-帕克领导防务部门
item.description: 美国飞机制造商波音公司周二表示，已任命内部人士斯蒂芬-帕克（Stephen Parker）担任其国防业务首席执行官。【原文：U.S. planemaker Boeing said on Tuesday it has appointed insider Stephen Parker as the CEO of its defense business.】

item.title: X 与印度就律师对政府官员的 "汤姆、迪克和哈里 "言论发生争执
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克的 X 公司的一名律师周二告诉印度一家法院，每一个 "汤姆、迪克和哈里 "政府官员都有权签发内容删除令，这招致了新德里律师在最新的内容审核冲突中的尖锐斥责。【原文：A lawyer for Elon Musk's X told an Indian court on Tuesday that every "Tom, Dick, and Harry" government official had been authorised to issue content takedown orders, drawing a sharp rebuke from New Delhi's counsel in the latest clash over content moderation.】

item.title: 在全球不确定性的背景下，激进投资者放缓了提出要求的步伐--数据
item.description: 新数据显示，由于关税、战争和美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）不可预测的政策让激进投资者更加谨慎，2025 年上半年，推动公司进行运营变革和管理层调整的激进投资者发起的活动减少了。【原文：Activist investors who push companies for operational changes and management shake-ups waged fewer campaigns during the first half of 2025 as tariffs, wars and U.S. President Donald Trump's unpredictable policies made them more cautious, new data show.】

item.title: 汇丰银行上调 2025 年和 2026 年黄金均价预测
item.description: 汇丰银行将 2025 年的黄金均价预期从每盎司 3,015 美元上调至 3,215 美元，将 2026 年的预期从 2,915 美元上调至 3,125 美元，理由是风险和政府债务增加。【原文：HSBC raised its 2025 average gold price forecast to $3,215 an ounce from $3,015 and its 2026 forecast to $3,125 from $2,915, citing elevated risks and government debt.】

item.title: 贝森特表示美国与印度的贸易协定非常接近
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周二表示，美国和印度即将达成协议，降低美国对南亚国家的进口关税，并帮助印度避免特朗普政府下周大幅提高征税。【原文：The U.S. and India are nearing a deal to lower tariffs on American imports to the South Asian country and to help India avoid levies imposed by the Trump administration rising sharply next week, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 莱茵金属公司首席执行官向德国电视台表示，希望到 2030 年销售额达到 500 亿欧元
item.description: 莱茵金属公司首席执行官 Armin Papperger 周二在接受 RTL 和 NTV 广播公司采访时表示，莱茵金属公司力争到 2030 年实现 400 亿至 500 亿欧元（590 亿美元）的销售额。【原文：Rheinmetall is seeking to reach sales of between 40 and 50 billion euros ($59 billion) by 2030, CEO Armin Papperger told broadcasters RTL and NTV in an interview published on Tuesday.】

item.title: 独家报道Grammarly 收购电子邮件初创公司 Superhuman，推动人工智能平台发展
item.description: Grammarly 的高管在接受路透社采访时表示，Grammarly 已经收购了电子邮件效率工具 Superhuman，这是该公司打造人工智能驱动的生产力套件和实现业务多元化的努力的一部分。【原文：Grammarly has acquired email efficiency tool Superhuman as part of the company's push to build an artificial intelligence-powered productivity suite and diversify its business, its executives told Reuters in an interview.】

item.title: 全球经济基础不稳，贝莱德着眼于短期押注
item.description: 贝莱德投资研究所（BII）周二表示，在全球经济前景日益不明朗的情况下，传统上稳定的长期经济趋势的不确定性日益增加，促使其转向短期策略。【原文：The BlackRock Investment Institute (BII) said on Tuesday that growing uncertainty around traditionally stable, long-term economic trends is pushing it toward shorter-term strategies amid an increasingly unclear global economic outlook.】

item.title: M&S 首席执行官：网络攻击的大部分影响将在八月前消除
item.description: 马莎百货公司首席执行官斯图尔特-麦金（Stuart Machin）在周二举行的零售商年度股东大会上告诉股东们，四月份马莎百货公司遭受的网络攻击的大部分影响将在八月份之前消除。【原文：Most of the impact of the cyberattack which hit Marks & Spencer M&S in April will be behind it by August, Chief Executive Stuart Machin told shareholders at the retailer's annual general meeting on Tuesday.】

item.title: 洞察力：稀土磁铁用户被迫为中国以外的供应支付高价
item.description: 多年来，拉希姆-苏莱曼（Rahim Suleman）多次联系汽车制造商和其他潜在客户，推销他的公司在爱沙尼亚建设的工厂生产的稀土磁铁。【原文：For years, Rahim Suleman had reached out repeatedly to automakers and other potential clients to market the rare earth magnets from the plant his company was building in Estonia, one of just a handful outside dominant producer China.】

item.title: 早间竞标参议院投票大戏继续上演
item.description: 本文仅代表欧洲、中东和非洲地区《金融市场》编辑 Dhara Ranasinghe 的观点。【原文：The opinions expressed here are those of Dhara Ranasinghe, Editor, Financial Markets, EMEA.】

item.title: 投资者关注特朗普的税收法案，期货价格在创下历史新高后下跌
item.description: 继华尔街股指创下历史新高之后，美国股市期货周二下跌，原因是投资者在关注美国贸易谈判以及参议院就唐纳德-特朗普总统的税收和支出法案进行的马拉松式投票。【原文：U.S. stock futures dipped on Tuesday, following a record run for Wall Street indexes, as investors monitored U.S. trade talks and a Senate voting marathon over President Donald Trump's tax and spending bill.】

item.title: 美国第二季度汽车销量将增长，关税可能推高价格
item.description: 在持续需求的推动下，美国汽车销量在第二季度将有所增长，但业内专家预测，唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税政策将在未来几个月给汽车价格带来压力。【原文：U.S. auto sales are set to rise in the second quarter aided by sustained demand, but industry experts forecast President Donald Trump's tariffs to pressure prices in the months ahead.】

item.title: 独家新闻： 消息人士称，DOGE 目前正瞄准 SEC 政策，关注 SPAC 规则
item.description: 据两位熟知内情的人士透露，唐纳德-特朗普总统的政府效率部倡议推动美国市场监督机构放松华尔街有关空白支票公司和私人投资基金保密报告的规定。【原文：President Donald Trump's Department of Government Efficiency initiative has pushed the U.S. markets watchdog to loosen Wall Street rules around blank-check companies and confidential reporting by private investment funds, according to two people familiar with the matter.】
